channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Broken glass at the end of Edinburgh Place, 21st May
item.description:
Broken glass at the end of Edinburgh Place. Can someone come and clear it up please? We need a litter bin at this location

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 2 Britten Place, Cheltenham

item.title: Three new potholes in a line just opened up on Brooklyn Road, 19th May
item.description:
Three new potholes in a line just opened up on Brooklyn Road. One of them at least itâ€™s down to the substrate and I hit it on my bicycle earlier. These are outside number six Brittan place there are four more outside 27 Brooklyn Road. Can somebody come and take a look please. Thank you

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 43 Brooklyn Road, Cheltenham

item.title: Encroaching hedges and shrubs, 18th May
item.description:
This walkway is a very busy route in the mornings as it is a vital route to Leckhampton Primary School. Unfortunately, roughly 25% of the width is taken up by shrubs and hedges growing on private property which means twice a day everyday parents and children have to stand on private land to allow others past. Clearing up access to this path would reduce the need for trespassing and trampling on residents gardens

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 4 Charnwood Road, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Footpath closure, 17th May
item.description:

item.title: Cover pushed off all looks like electrical works outside Hobart house on Princess Elizabeth Way, 15th May
item.description:

item.title: Flytipped Material at the location., 15th May
item.description:
The location is the Entrance to the Old Quarry off Cleeve Common Road. There is rubbish in front of the entrance wall but more importantly behind the wall which has been used as a burn area there is a quantity of plastic string / shredded material. Please can it be cleared up.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): The Dingle, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Graffiti in cut through, 14th May
item.description:

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 92 Suffolk Road, Cheltenham
